definition: to sit astride/to ride (a horse, bike etc)/classifier for saddle horses
various genera of flowers of Asteracea family (daisies and chrysanthemums), including Atractylis lancea

sentences.english: Tashi one-upmanship, eventually obtaining victory like riding.
sentences.chinese: 扎西騎術更勝一籌，最終獲得勝利。

sentences.english: She is proud of her horsemanship.
sentences.chinese: 她爲自己的騎術感到自豪。

sentences.english: Myra, the youngest, was a rodeo queen.
sentences.chinese: 邁拉是最小的孩子，騎術女王。

sentences.english: Wearing stars and stripes, a cowboy watches rodeo events from the chutes.
sentences.chinese: 一位身着星條旗服裝的牛仔在斜槽後觀看着騎術表演。

sentences.english: Then as for active exercise , she could ride on horseback as well as any man in his kingdom.
sentences.chinese: 至於說到實際的運動，她的騎術不弱於國內任何男子。

sentences.english: Joe, a clumsy and timid horseman, did not look to advantage in the saddle.
sentences.chinese: 喬膽子小，騎術又拙，騎在鞍子上老不象樣。

sentences.english: Does your dwarf ride as well as he pisses?
sentences.chinese: 小侏儒的騎術和尿藝比如何？

definition: lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
fight a battle of words/cross verbal swords
to beat sb at their own game (idiom)
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
(idiom) to talk in a roundabout way to cover up the truth/evasive
lit. the salted fish turns over (idiom)/fig. to experience a reversal of fortune
rigorous schemes and deep foresight (idiom); astute and circumspect
seize every minute and second (idiom); not a minute to lose/every moment counts
